title: Replace homepage background with user photo and apply dark overlay with fixed positioning

requirements.summary: Remove the existing old-man picture (1770720033234.jpg) from the Home page hero section entirely
acceptanceCriteria: The circular user photo previously displayed below the 'MHS★Online Earn Platform' title is removed from the DOM
No references to 1770720033234.jpg remain in the Home page component

file_operations.description: Remove the circular user profile image element that references 1770720033234.jpg from the hero section. Delete the img element and its container div that displays the user photo below the title.

requirements.summary: Set the uploaded user photo (1770720033234-1.jpg) as the background image for the Hero Section on the Home page
acceptanceCriteria: The uploaded photo 1770720033234-1.jpg is rendered as a background image covering the hero section
Background image uses CSS background-size: cover and background-position: center for proper display
The hero section maintains its existing layout with all text and buttons visible

file_operations.description: Apply inline styles or className to the hero section container to set background-image pointing to /assets/1770720033234-1.jpg, with background-size: cover and background-position: center. Ensure the hero section maintains its existing structure with all content visible.

requirements.summary: Apply a dark transparent overlay (rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.5) or similar) on top of the background image to ensure white text remains clearly readable
acceptanceCriteria: A semi-transparent black overlay is applied between the background image and the hero section content
The 'MHS★Online Earn Platform' title text and all other white text elements have sufficient contrast for readability
The overlay does not obscure the background image completely but provides clear text legibility

file_operations.description: Add a dark overlay layer using a pseudo-element (::before) or an additional div with rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.5) background color positioned absolutely over the background image but behind the hero content. Ensure proper z-index layering so text remains on top and readable.

requirements.summary: Configure the background image with CSS background-attachment: fixed so it stays in place when scrolling the page
acceptanceCriteria: The background image uses background-attachment: fixed CSS property
When scrolling the page, the background image remains stationary while content scrolls over it
The fixed background effect works on desktop and tablet viewports (may fall back to scroll on mobile for performance)

file_operations.description: Add background-attachment: fixed to the hero section's background image styles. Consider using a media query to apply fixed attachment only on larger viewports (min-width: 768px) and fall back to scroll on mobile for performance.
